Posts.Content: ashisonfire wrote: I found a lump on my left breast about a week ago now, made a gyno appointment the day after and was sent to get a sonogram after they confirmed the weird lumb. The sonogram did find something so i'm waiting to get a biopsy a week from now. This whole process has taken a real toll on me and i'm inexplicably worried. The biopsy itself sounds scary and i'm not looking forward to that but i know the sooner, the better. Can anyone give me feedback on the biopsy procedure and any advice to calm my nerves? -ash Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: new member and very stressed ashisonfire ashisonfire
new member and very stressed ashisonfire ashisonfire

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2011 09:09PM ashisonfire wrote: You all seem so sweet. I really do appreciate all the replies. Im so relieved to hear there isn't much (if any) pain involved. Irr4993: it does seem weird you were more stressed waiting for the results but then again to actually find out what it was and not be in the dark may have been a relief though it wasn't the ideal outcome. I really appreciate your feedback. Marie5890: Good point on the sports bra, i wouldn't have thought of that. Any bit helps! I'm sure i'm working myself up over nothing as you've confirmed the images are worse than the procedure itself. Karenlen: Thank you for confirming the painless procedure. I'm not AS worried though i guess it's human nature to worry about things like this. I don't intend on looking as that might freak me out more. Thanks for mentiong the fact you were able to drive afterwards. That helps :)
Posts.Title: new member and very stressed ashisonfire ashisonfire

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2011 09:19PM ashisonfire wrote: I'm shocked at all the quick responses i'm getting. Honestly, i'm already feeling a lot better because even if the results do come back not in my favor, i'll have so much support and women to talk to here. I'm still at a loss for words at how caring and supportive you woman are. Thank you so much, really. Shelleyj43: Thanks so much for the warning about the vacuum sound. That definitley would have scared me and made me jump.Â  Jo1955: Thanks for mentioning the fact that it only takes a bandaid and no stiches. Charley: I really appreciate your support. You're right, i shouldn't worry too much before getting any results. I'm the stubborn type that pushes health issues off but as worried as i am, i know i'm making the right choice in getting the tests done early.

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2011 04:58PM ashisonfire wrote: Thank you so much for all the feedback, advice and hugs. My biopsy is tomorrow and though i am still a tad bit worried, i feel a whole lot better because of how wonderful you've all been. I'll keep in touch!

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 08:36PM ashisonfire wrote: Yes that's the name of the tumor. The dr made it seem like it can keep growing and that it would be best if i remove so i never have to worry but if i can avoid the surgery because it's harmless to begin with, i'd rather that.

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 01:55PM ashisonfire wrote: It turns out the lump was not cancer but in fact a tumor. I wish i could remember the name of the tumor, i know it started with an "F" but it can continue to grow. I have an appointment with a breast surgeon in march to talk about removing it. I'm relieved it is not cancer but still worried about the fact that i have this tumor and have to wait until the middle of march to find out if i nee surgery (which i've never had befor)
